info.description: API for interacting and managing a Liqid installation.
info.title: Liqid REST Api

tags.name: assembly-controller
tags.description:
Endpoint for handling all assemble/disassemble actions.

The assembly functionality allows a user to assemble machines based on previous configurations. In the case of all, each machine belonging to the group will be recreated based on a previous configuration.

Disassembly will do the exact opposite: it will remove all devices associated with a machine. In the case of all, every machine belonging to the group will be dismantled. All removed devices are returned to the free pool and are available as normal.

Reprogram the fabric. This will result in devices associated with a machine being electrically connected to the machine. This step MUST be done in order for a device to be added to a machine.

get.summary: Reports information for all known devices on the system, regardless of whether the device is associated with a group or machine. Devices in a current deferred state will also be reported.

AssemblyTimestamp.title: AssemblyTimestamp
AssemblyTimestamp.description: Represents the start and end times associated with a machine's connection history.

data.description: Describes pertinent data associated with the auth mode of the system. For some modes, this value will not contain any data but should never be null.

mode.description: The auth mode of the deployment. Current possible values are 'none', 'basic' and 'provided'.

AuthMetaData.title: AuthMetaData
AuthMetaData.description: Defines auth meta data as per the auth mode of the deployment.

jwk-set-uri.description: The OIDC jwk set uri attribute.

AuthProviderConfiguration.title: AuthProviderConfiguration
AuthProviderConfiguration.description: OIDC provider configuration. Contains attributes specific to OIDC and the actual provider implemenation.

enclosure_index.description: Enclosure index. Must be unique and greater or equal to zero.

vendor_id.description: Vendor id. Id must be greater than 0

fabr_gid.description: The fabric gid of the device. Must be a hexadecimal value.

fabr_id.description: The fabric id of the device. Must be an integer greater than 0.

location.description: Location description here. Takes the form rack/shelf/node

name.description: The name of the device. Cannot be null.

owner.description: Owner description here. Takes the form rack/shelf/node

type.description: Identifies the concrete DeviceStatus implementation. Valid values are: ComputeDeviceStatus|GpuDeviceStatus|SsdDeviceStatus|LinkDeviceStatus|FpgaDeviceStatus

description.description: The associated description object. Used to describe how a client will display this entry.

key.description: The configuration entry key. The key will match an actual entry name found in a Liqid configuration file.

value.description: The configuration entry value. This value will have a direct effect on Liqid behavior.

ConfigurationEntry.title: ConfigurationEntry
ConfigurationEntry.description: Represents a single configuration entry found in a Liqid configuration file.

entries.description: List of configuration entries associated with this stanza.

ConfigurationEntryStanza.title: ConfigurationEntryStanza
ConfigurationEntryStanza.description: Represents a configuration entry stanza. A stanza in this sense is a set of configuration details which pertain to a specific part of the daemon. There can be multiple stanzas in a configuration and each one will contain the same attribute names.

value.description: The value of the flag, in hex

ControlFlag.title: ControlFlag
ControlFlag.description: Control flags are flags which define specific values which can be used to query the system for specific states.

DeviceDescription.title: DeviceDescription
DeviceDescription.description: Represents a device description or user modified data associated with a device.

fabr_gid.description: The fabric gid of the device. Must be a hexadecimal value.

fabr_id.description: The fabric id of the device. Must be an integer greater than 0.

location.description: Location description here. Takes the form rack/shelf/node

name.description: The name of the device. Cannot be null.

owner.description: Owner description here. Takes the form rack/shelf/node

type.description: Identifies the concrete DeviceStatus implementation. Valid values are: ComputeDeviceStatus|GpuDeviceStatus|SsdDeviceStatus|LinkDeviceStatus|FpgaDeviceStatus

fabr_gid.description: Fabric gid. Gid must not be empty

fabr_id.description: Fabric id. Id must be greater than 0

fabric_type.description: Enclosure type. Type must not be null

flags.description: Enclosure flags. Flags must not be empty

index.description: Enclosure index. Must be unique and greater or equal to zero.

ipmi_connection.description: IPMI connection. Connection must not be null

location.description: Enclosure location. Location must not be null

model.description: Model. Model must not be empty

name.description: Enclosure name. Name must not be empty

redfish_connection.description: Redfish connection. Connection must not be null

vapi_connection.description: Vapi connection. Connection must not be null

vendor_id.description: Vendor id. Id must be greater than 0

vendor_name.description: Vendor name. Vendor must not be empty

EnclosureAppendOperation.title: EnclosureAppendOperation
EnclosureAppendOperation.description: Enclosure append operation description goes here.

arguments.description: The arguments associated with the enclosure command.

cmd_class.description: The class type for which this command is associated with.

command.description: The name of the actual command to apply.

index.description: The id of the actual command to apply.

EnclosureOperation.title: EnclosureOperation
EnclosureOperation.description: Enclosure operation. There can be one or more operations applied to configure an enclosure.

descriptions.description: Descriptions. Descriptions must not be null

fabr_gid.description: Fabric gid. Gid must not be empty

location.description: Enclosure location. Location must not be null

mod_date.description: Modification date. Date must not be empty

name.description: Enclosure name. Name must not be empty

res_type.description: Resource type. Resource type must not be empty

vendor_name.description: Vendor name. Vendor must not be empty

fabr_altlogin.description: The configuration entry key. The key will match an actual entry name found in a Liqid configuration file.

fabr_connect.description: The configuration entry key. The key will match an actual entry name found in a Liqid configuration file.

fabr_encl.description: The configuration entry key. The key will match an actual entry name found in a Liqid configuration file.

fabr_thresh.description: The configuration entry key. The key will match an actual entry name found in a Liqid configuration file.

fabr_type.description: The configuration entry key. The key will match an actual entry name found in a Liqid configuration file.

FabricConfigurationEntry.title: FabricConfigurationEntry
FabricConfigurationEntry.description: Represents a single fabric configuration entry found in the Liqid configuration file.

id.description: The actual id of the fabric. Must be a positive number.

FabricId.title: FabricId
FabricId.description: Model which represents the id of a fabric. Used to allow for a client to communicate with the server regarding fabric id values.

fabr_gid.description: The fabric gid of the device. Must be a hexadecimal value.

fabr_id.description: The fabric id of the device. Must be an integer greater than 0.

location.description: Location description here. Takes the form rack/shelf/node

name.description: The name of the device. Cannot be null.

owner.description: Owner description here. Takes the form rack/shelf/node

type.description: Identifies the concrete DeviceStatus implementation. Valid values are: ComputeDeviceStatus|GpuDeviceStatus|SsdDeviceStatus|LinkDeviceStatus|FpgaDeviceStatus

location.description: Location description here. Takes the form rack/shelf/node

name.description: The name of the device. Cannot be null.

owner.description: Owner description here. Takes the form rack/shelf/node

type.description: Identifies the concrete DeviceStatus implementation. Valid values are: ComputeDeviceStatus|GpuDeviceStatus|SsdDeviceStatus|LinkDeviceStatus|FpgaDeviceStatus

fabr_id.description: Fabric id for which the group will belong.

group_name.description: Group name. Must contain at least one character.

grp_id.description: Group id field. Must be unique and greater than zero.

pod_id.description: The Liqid pod id for which this group belongs. Must be a positive integer unless the group is not associated with a pod in which case a value of -1 will be used.

assemblyTimestamp.description: The assembly timestamp to be applied during the assembly action.

group.description: The group for which all assembly actions will be applied.

GroupAssembly.title: GroupAssembly
GroupAssembly.description: Represents the Group specific information required for assembly actions.

deviceStatus.description: The device for which to add to the group.

group.description: The group for which the device will be added.

GroupDeviceRelator.title: GroupDeviceRelator
GroupDeviceRelator.description: Model for representing the relationship between a group and device

coordinates.description: The LiqidCoordinates value associated with the group for which devices should be added/removed.

fabr_id.description: The fabric id which contains the associated group for which devices should be added/removed.

grp_id.description: The group id representing the group for which devices should be added/removed.

GroupPool.title: GroupPool
GroupPool.description: Model which represents the Group for which devices should be added/removed.

arguments.description: The arguments to apply while upgrading the system.

filename.description: The name of the actual image.

time_frame.description: The time frame for which this upgrade will take place.

type.description: The concrete type. This is used for serialization/de-serialization only.

device.description: The device for which the image will be applied.

image.description: The image to apply to the device.

machine.description: The machine which contains the device for which the image will be applied.

ImageContext.title: ImageContext
ImageContext.description: Model which represents an image context. An ImageContext contains information necessary to apply an image to a Device associated with a Machine.

fabric_id.description: The actual id of the fabric. Must be a positive number.

type.description: Identifies the concrete Manageable implementations. Valid values are: ManageableDevice|ManageableCpuIpmiNetworkConfig|ManageableEnclosureIpmiNetworkConfig

fabr_gid.description: The fabric gid of the device. Must be a hexadecimal value.

fabr_id.description: The fabric id of the device. Must be an integer greater than 0.

location.description: Location description here. Takes the form rack/shelf/node

name.description: The name of the device. Cannot be null.

owner.description: Owner description here. Takes the form rack/shelf/node

type.description: Identifies the concrete DeviceStatus implementation. Valid values are: ComputeDeviceStatus|GpuDeviceStatus|SsdDeviceStatus|LinkDeviceStatus|FpgaDeviceStatus

node.description: The id of the physical node for which the entity resides. Value must be >= 0.

rack.description: The id of the physical rack for which the entity resides. Value must be >= 0.

shelf.description: The id of the physical shelf for which the entity resides. Value must be >= 0.

LiqidCoordinates.title: LiqidCoordinates
LiqidCoordinates.description: Model which represents the physical location of some entity in the Liqid environment.

configurationEntries.description: The configuration entries associated with this daemon.

configurationEntryStanzas.description: The configuration entry stanzas associated with this daemon.

fabricConfigurationEntries.description: The fabric configuration entries associated with this daemon.

portSetConfigurationEntries.description: The port_set configuration entries associated with this daemon.

LiqidDaemonConfiguration.title: LiqidDaemonConfiguration
LiqidDaemonConfiguration.description: Represents the configuraton for a specific Liqid daemon. Currently the possible daemons are liqcfgd and liqmond.

key.description: String value used to describe a DegradedSteps instance.

steps.description: The actual steps to mitigate the degraded system.

type.description: Identifies the concrete Manageable implementations. Valid values are: ManageableDevice|ManageableCpuIpmiNetworkConfig|ManageableEnclosureIpmiNetworkConfig

address.description: The IP address associated with this instance.

coordinates.description: The LiqidCoordinates associated with this instance.

LiqidNodeCoordinates.title: LiqidNodeCoordinates
LiqidNodeCoordinates.description: Model which represents the relationship between a LiqidCoordinate and a deployed web application instance.

epoch.description: The time of the reset in milliseconds since the epoch.

comp_name.description: The cpu associated with this machine. N/A if no cpu is associated with this machine.

connection_history.description: The connection histories associated with this machine.

fabr_id.description: Fabric id for which the machine will belong. Must be greater than 0.

grp_id.description: Group id field. Must be unique and greater than zero.

index.description: This is an internal value and should be ignored.

mach_id.description: The machine id. Must be unique and greater than 0.

mach_name.description: The name of the machine. Cannot be null.

mtime.description: The Unix epoch creation time for the machine.

p2p.description: Is p2p enabled? Values are on|off

assemblyTimestamp.description: The assembly timestamp to be applied during the assembly action.

machine.description: The machine for which all assembly actions will be applied.

MachineAssembly.title: MachineAssembly
MachineAssembly.description: Represents the machine specific information required for assembly actions.

type.description: Identifies the concrete Manageable implementations. Valid values are: ManageableDevice|ManageableCpuIpmiNetworkConfig|ManageableEnclosureIpmiNetworkConfig

groupDeviceRelator.description: The device for which to add to the machine.

machine.description: The machine for which the device will be added.

MachineDeviceRelator.title: MachineDeviceRelator
MachineDeviceRelator.description: Model for representing the relationship between a machine and device

device_gid.description: The gid of the busy device.

device_name.description: The name of the busy device.

machine.description: The machine which has a busy device.

port.description: The port which the busy device is connected.

type.description: The device type of the busy device.
Identifies the concrete Manageable implementations. Valid values are: ManageableDevice|ManageableCpuIpmiNetworkConfig|ManageableEnclosureIpmiNetworkConfig

enclosure_name.description: The enclosure which is configured with these network settings.

type.description: Identifies the concrete Manageable implementations. Valid values are: ManageableDevice|ManageableCpuIpmiNetworkConfig|ManageableEnclosureIpmiNetworkConfig

active.description: Describes if the entry is active. An active entry is one which is not commented and whos value is currently loaded into memory.

required.description: Describes if the entry is required. A required entry is on which must be included in a configuration and cannot under any circumstance be commented out.

ManageableEntryDescription.title: ManageableEntryDescription
ManageableEntryDescription.description: Represents a descriptor for a configuration entry

fabrics.description: The Liqid fabric(s) to be associated with provider role.

MappableFabric.title: MappableFabric
MappableFabric.description: Associates a 3rd party provider role name to some number of Liqid fabric ids.

groups.description: The Liqid group(s) to be associated with the provider role.

MappableGroup.title: MappableGroup
MappableGroup.description: Associates a 3rd party provider role name to some number of Liqid group names

liqid-role.description: The Liqid role to be associated with the provider role.

MappableRole.title: MappableRole
MappableRole.description: Associates a 3rd party provider role name to a Liqid role name.

NodeStatus.title: NodeStatus
NodeStatus.description: Model which represents the status of a specific node. A node should be thought of a unique host or CPU. The use of the word 'node' should not imply any association with a clustered system.

coordinates.description: Enclosure location. Location must not be null

fabric.description: Fabric id. Id must be greater than 0

status.description: The current satus of the northbound application

key.description: String value used to describe a DegradedSteps instance.

steps.description: The actual steps to mitigate the degraded system.

type.description: Identifies the concrete Manageable implementations. Valid values are: ManageableDevice|ManageableCpuIpmiNetworkConfig|ManageableEnclosureIpmiNetworkConfig

mappings.description: Describes the actual role to Liqid entity association.

RoleToFabricMapping.title: RoleToFabricMapping
RoleToFabricMapping.description: The current provider role to Liqid fabric associations.

mappings.description: Describes the actual role to Liqid entity association.

RoleToGroupMapping.title: RoleToGroupMapping
RoleToGroupMapping.description: The current provider role to Liqid group associations.

mappings.description: Describes the actual role to Liqid entity association.

RoleToRoleMapping.title: RoleToRoleMapping
RoleToRoleMapping.description: The current provider role to Liqid role association.

fabric_id.description: The actual id of the fabric. Must be a positive number.

type.description: Identifies the concrete Manageable implementations. Valid values are: ManageableDevice|ManageableCpuIpmiNetworkConfig|ManageableEnclosureIpmiNetworkConfig

fabr_gid.description: The fabric gid of the device. Must be a hexadecimal value.

fabr_id.description: The fabric id of the device. Must be an integer greater than 0.

location.description: Location description here. Takes the form rack/shelf/node

name.description: The name of the device. Cannot be null.

owner.description: Owner description here. Takes the form rack/shelf/node

type.description: Identifies the concrete DeviceStatus implementation. Valid values are: ComputeDeviceStatus|GpuDeviceStatus|SsdDeviceStatus|LinkDeviceStatus|FpgaDeviceStatus

arguments.description: The arguments to apply while upgrading the system.
